meanings.definition: To roll about or lie in water, snow, mud, dust, or the like, as for refreshment
meanings.sent1: The pig was wallowing in the cool mud on a hot day.
meanings.sent2: The elephant was wallowing in the river to cool off.
meanings.sent3: The hippo looked happy wallowing in the muddy water.
meanings.sent4: The children were wallowing in the snow, creating snow angels.
meanings.sent5: The buffalo was wallowing in the dust to protect itself from insects.

meanings.definition: To indulge oneself in an emotion or situation
meanings.sent1: She was wallowing in self-pity after failing the test.
meanings.sent2: He was wallowing in happiness after receiving good news.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be wallowing in contentment as it purred.
meanings.sent4: The character in the book was wallowing in despair after a breakup.
meanings.sent5: The dog was wallowing in excitement, wagging its tail vigorously.

meanings.definition: To move with difficulty or clumsily
meanings.sent1: The injured dog was wallowing on three legs, trying to walk.
meanings.sent2: The tired hiker was wallowing through the thick mud on the trail.
meanings.sent3: The toddler was wallowing around the room, bumping into furniture.
meanings.sent4: The old car was wallowing along the bumpy road, struggling to keep up.
meanings.sent5: The robot was wallowing through the obstacle course, bumping into walls.
